_comment: United States compliance norms and standards database. Includes FCC, UL, FDA, CPSC, OSHA, EPA, NIST and other US regulatory requirements. Updated for 2025 compliance requirements.

norms.name: Unintentional Radiators - Computing Devices
norms.description: Limits for unintentional radio frequency emissions from digital devices. Class A (industrial) and Class B (residential) limits. Mandatory FCC certification for most digital products.

norms.name: Intentional Radiators - ISM Equipment
norms.applies_to: WiFi, Bluetooth, wireless devices in ISM bands
norms.description: Technical requirements for intentional radiators operating in unlicensed ISM bands (900MHz, 2.4GHz, 5GHz). Includes WiFi, Bluetooth, Zigbee devices.

norms.name: Unlicensed National Information Infrastructure (U-NII)
norms.description: Requirements for U-NII devices operating in 5GHz bands. Includes DFS (Dynamic Frequency Selection) and TPC (Transmit Power Control) requirements.

norms.name: Industrial, Scientific and Medical Equipment
norms.applies_to: ISM equipment using RF energy for non-communication purposes
norms.description: Requirements for equipment using RF energy for industrial, scientific, medical, or other non-communication purposes (microwave ovens, RF welders, medical diathermy).

norms.name: Public Mobile Services
norms.description: Requirements for public mobile services including cellular radiotelephone service.

norms.name: Miscellaneous Wireless Communications Services
norms.description: Requirements for various wireless services including Broadband Radio Service (BRS) and Educational Broadband Service (EBS).

norms.name: Connection of Terminal Equipment to Telephone Network
norms.description: Technical requirements for equipment connecting to public switched telephone network. Prevents harm to network.

norms.name: Specific Absorption Rate (SAR) for Mobile Devices
norms.description: SAR limit of 1.6 W/kg averaged over 1 gram of tissue. Required testing for devices used within 20cm of body.

norms.name: Audio/Video, Information and Communication Technology Equipment
norms.description: US adoption of IEC 62368-1. Hazard-based safety standard for ICT equipment. Replaces UL 60950-1. Mandatory for many products.

norms.name: Information Technology Equipment - Safety
norms.description: LEGACY standard for IT equipment safety. Withdrawn December 2020, replaced by UL 62368-1. Still referenced in some certifications.

norms.name: Household and Commercial Batteries
norms.description: Safety requirements for household and commercial batteries including lithium-ion. Covers cell and battery pack safety.

norms.name: Lithium Batteries
norms.description: Safety standard for lithium batteries used as power sources. Covers design and manufacturing requirements.

norms.name: Power Banks
norms.applies_to: Portable USB power banks and chargers
norms.description: Safety requirements for power banks used to charge mobile devices. Covers electrical, fire, mechanical hazards.

norms.name: Class 2 Power Units
norms.applies_to: Low voltage power supplies, AC adapters
norms.description: Safety standard for Class 2 power units with limited output (100VA). Common for consumer electronics adapters.

norms.name: Power Units Other Than Class 2
norms.description: Safety standard for power units exceeding Class 2 limits. Covers higher wattage power supplies.

norms.name: Portable Electric Luminaires
norms.description: Safety requirements for portable lighting products. Covers electrical, fire, mechanical hazards.

norms.name: Luminaires (Fixed)
norms.description: Safety standard for fixed luminaires. Covers installation, construction, electrical safety.

norms.name: Light Emitting Diode (LED) Equipment
norms.description: Safety requirements specific to LED equipment for lighting. Covers electrical, thermal, photobiological hazards.

norms.name: Energy Storage Systems
norms.description: Safety standard for energy storage systems (ESS) including residential and commercial battery systems.

norms.name: Software Cybersecurity for Network-Connectable Products
norms.description: Evaluates software cybersecurity capabilities of network-connectable products. Covers vulnerability management, authentication, cryptography.

norms.name: Software Cybersecurity for Network-Connectable Products - General Requirements
norms.description: General cybersecurity requirements for network-connectable products. Foundation for UL 2900 series.

norms.name: Software Cybersecurity for Healthcare Systems
norms.description: Cybersecurity requirements specific to healthcare and wellness systems.

norms.name: Software Cybersecurity for Security/Life Safety Signaling Systems
norms.description: Cybersecurity requirements for connected security and life safety systems.

norms.name: National Electrical Code
norms.description: US electrical installation code. Covers wiring, electrical equipment installation. Adopted by most US jurisdictions. Updated every 3 years.

norms.name: Electrical Standard for Industrial Machinery
norms.description: Electrical safety requirements for industrial machines. Harmonized with IEC standards.

norms.name: Quality System Regulation (QSR) for Medical Devices
norms.description: FDA quality system regulation for medical devices. Covers design controls, CAPA, risk management. Similar to ISO 13485.

norms.name: Electronic Records and Electronic Signatures
norms.description: Requirements for electronic records and signatures to be trustworthy and equivalent to paper records. Critical for software medical devices.

norms.name: Premarket Notification
norms.applies_to: Class II medical devices (most medical devices)
norms.description: FDA premarket notification process demonstrating device is substantially equivalent to legally marketed device. Required for most medical devices.

norms.name: Premarket Approval
norms.description: Most stringent FDA device marketing application. Required for high-risk devices. Includes clinical data requirements.

norms.name: Indirect Food Additives: Polymers
norms.description: Regulations for polymeric substances used in food contact. Required for food containers, utensils, packaging.

norms.name: Food Contact Substance Notification
norms.description: FDA notification process for food contact substances. Required before marketing food contact materials not already approved.

norms.name: Poison Prevention Packaging
norms.description: Requirements for child-resistant packaging. Applies to certain household substances, medications, products hazardous to children.

norms.name: Hazardous Substances and Articles
norms.description: Requirements for labeling, packaging of hazardous household products. Includes toxicity, flammability, corrosivity requirements.

norms.name: Small Parts Regulation
norms.applies_to: Toys and articles for children under 3
norms.description: Prohibits small parts in toys and articles for young children. Prevents choking hazards. Includes test cylinder requirements.

norms.name: Consumer Product Safety Improvement Act
norms.description: Comprehensive law including lead limits, phthalate restrictions, third-party testing requirements for children's products. Includes tracking labels.

norms.name: Safe Drinking Water and Toxic Enforcement Act
norms.applies_to: Products sold in California containing listed chemicals
norms.description: Requires warnings for products containing chemicals known to cause cancer or reproductive harm. List includes 900+ chemicals. Required warning label.

norms.name: California Energy Efficiency Standards
norms.applies_to: Electronic devices, appliances sold in California
norms.description: California energy efficiency requirements for various products including battery chargers, computers, displays. Often stricter than federal standards.

norms.name: Energy Star Certification
norms.description: EPA/DOE voluntary program for energy-efficient products. Market advantage and required for some government procurement. Category-specific requirements.

norms.name: Energy Conservation Standards for Consumer Products
norms.description: Mandatory federal energy efficiency standards for appliances and equipment. Includes test procedures and minimum efficiency levels.

norms.name: Security Requirements for Cryptographic Modules
norms.description: Required for cryptographic modules sold to US government. Defines security levels 1-4. Includes physical security, key management requirements.

norms.name: Framework for Improving Critical Infrastructure Cybersecurity
norms.description: Voluntary framework providing guidelines for cybersecurity. Five functions: Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, Recover. Widely adopted.

norms.name: Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems
norms.description: Comprehensive catalog of security and privacy controls for federal systems. Referenced in FedRAMP and defense contracts.

norms.name: Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI)
norms.description: Required for contractors handling CUI including defense contractors. Subset of 800-53 controls. Mandatory for DFARS compliance.

norms.name: Standard Consumer Safety Specification for Toy Safety
norms.description: Comprehensive toy safety standard covering mechanical, flammability, toxicity, electrical hazards. Referenced by CPSC. Includes age grading.

norms.name: Standard Practice for Distribution Packaging
norms.description: Performance testing of shipping containers. Defines test schedules for various distribution environments. Industry standard for package testing.

norms.name: Environmental Site Assessments
norms.description: Standard for Phase I Environmental Site Assessments. Not directly product-related but important for manufacturing facilities.

norms.name: Standard Method for Evaluating Sleep Modes
norms.description: Methodology for measuring and reporting low-power modes in audio, video and information technology equipment.

norms.name: Rechargeable Batteries for Mobile Phones
norms.description: Safety standard for rechargeable battery systems for mobile phones and other portable products. Covers electrical, mechanical, environmental tests.

norms.name: Wireless LAN (WiFi) Standards
norms.description: Family of standards for wireless local area networks. Includes 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ax (WiFi 6). Defines MAC and PHY layer requirements.

norms.name: Wireless Personal Area Networks (Bluetooth)
norms.description: Standard for Bluetooth wireless technology. PHY and MAC layer specifications. Bluetooth SIG manages certification.

norms.name: Ethernet Standards
norms.description: Family of standards for wired Ethernet networks. Includes various speeds from 10Mbps to 400Gbps. Includes Power over Ethernet (PoE).

norms.name: Occupational Safety and Health Act Section 5(a)(1)
norms.description: Requires employers to provide workplace free from recognized hazards. Applies when no specific OSHA standard exists.

norms.name: Occupational Safety and Health Standards
norms.description: Comprehensive workplace safety standards covering machinery, electrical, personal protective equipment, hazard communication.

norms.name: Toxic Substances Control Act
norms.description: EPA authority to regulate chemicals. Includes inventory reporting, new chemical review, existing chemical risk evaluation. Asbestos, PCB regulations.

norms.name: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act
norms.description: Governs hazardous waste from generation to disposal. Affects manufacturers generating hazardous waste. Includes e-waste considerations.

norms.name: Energy Star Program Requirements
norms.description: Voluntary program with category-specific energy efficiency requirements. Provides market differentiation and government procurement preference.

norms.name: Transportation of Dangerous Goods - Lithium Batteries
norms.applies_to: Products with lithium batteries being shipped
norms.description: Requirements for shipping lithium batteries by air, ground, sea. Includes packaging, labeling, documentation. Harmonized with UN 38.3 testing.

norms.name: International Safe Transit Association Package Testing
norms.description: Package performance testing standards. ISTA 2A (packaged products 150 lbs or less) commonly required by retailers like Amazon.

norms.name: ISTA 6-Amazon.com-SIOC
norms.description: Ships In Own Container (SIOC) certification. Package must survive distribution without additional packaging. Reduces waste, improves customer experience.
